title: Main source of news in selected countries 2017
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 9 different Countrys on X-axis for 5 groups Online (excl. social media), Online (incl. social media), TV, Print, and Radio. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Country Italy had the maximum Share of respondents among all 5 groups, and it was for TV. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Country Italy for Radio.
There is a gap of 20.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Online (excl. social media) in Country Sweden and Italy.

On average, the Country Sweden had the highest Share of respondents for all 5 groups Online (excl. social media), Online (incl. social media), TV, Print, and Radio. Whereas Germany had the lowest average Share of respondents.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 9 different Countrys on X-axis for 5 groups Online (excl. social media), Online (incl. social media), TV, Print, and Radio. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Country Italy had the maximum Share of respondents among all 5 groups, and it was for TV. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Country Italy for Radio.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 9 different Countrys on X-axis for 5 groups Online (excl. social media), Online (incl. social media), TV, Print, and Radio. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of respondents.
Country Italy had the maximum Share of respondents among all 5 groups, and it was for TV. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Country Italy for Radio.
There is a gap of 20.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Online (excl. social media) in Country Sweden and Italy.

On average, the Country Sweden had the highest Share of respondents for all 5 groups Online (excl. social media), Online (incl. social media), TV, Print, and Radio. Whereas Germany had the lowest average Share of respondents.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of respondents on the Y-axis for 9 different Countrys for 5 groups Online (excl. social media), Online (incl. social media), TV, Print, and Radio that are presented on the X-axis.
Country Italy had the maximum Share of respondents among all 5 groups, and it was for TV. The minimum Share of respondents was observed in Country Italy for Radio.
Among all the Countrys, Online (excl. social media) had the highest Share of respondents 39.0 in Country Sweden and lowest value 19.0 in Country Italy.
There is a gap of 20.0 between the highest and lowest Share of respondents found for Online (excl. social media) in Country Sweden and Italy.
Out of all 5 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Share of respondents was found in case of TV.

In case of Country Italy, TV had the highest Share of respondents 59.0 among the 5 groups and in Italy, Radio had the lowest Share of respondents 4.0. The second highest Share of respondents 15.0 was observed for TV in Country Italy.

Averaging all 5 groups Online (excl. social media), Online (incl. social media), TV, Print, and Radio, the Country Sweden is the maximum Share of respondents and Germany is the minimum Share of respondents.
